alert.note: Alert for Outagamie; Portage; Shawano; Southern Marinette County; Southern Oconto County; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 07 at 2:26PM CST until January 10 at 3:00AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: .A potent winter system will move northwards into the Great Lakes region Monday night into Tuesday, bringing heavy snowfall and gusty winds. The greatest snowfall will occur over the day Tuesday. Highest snowfall amounts are expected to be in east-central Wisconsin, where lake enhancement seems likely. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 7 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central to northeastern Wisconsin. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning and evening commutes. Falling snow will limit visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow could start as early as Monday evening but the most impactful timeframe will be Tuesday morning through Tuesday night. Winds will increase during this period, as the highest snowfall amounts fall.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
